separation_of_concerns.details: Each tool isolated in dedicated directory. No cross-contamination between packages.

installation_scripts.details: Interactive install.sh with OS detection, conflict resolution, and backups. Well-documented with color-coded output.

health_checks.details: Standalone health-check.sh script exists (385 lines) but not integrated into CI/CD pipeline yet.

architecture_documentation.details: Dedicated ARCHITECTURE.md (273 lines) explaining GNU Stow, package structure, and workflows.

backup_system.details: snapshot.sh script (341 lines) + automatic backups in installer before conflicts.

package_management.notes: All packages follow correct structure. No violations detected.

documentation_hierarchy.pattern: Centralized docs/ with package READMEs as entry points

dependency_management.notes: 5 zsh plugins properly tracked in .gitmodules. No orphaned submodules.

installation_workflow.pattern: Interactive installer with conflict resolution + manual Stow fallback
installation_workflow.notes: Installer handles edge cases. Manual instructions in docs/INSTALL.md.

testing_strategy.pattern: CI/CD with linting + dry-run tests per package
testing_strategy.notes: ShellCheck, Luacheck, Stow tests present. Missing integration test (health-check).

scalability_considerations.adding_new_packages: Trivial - documented process in ARCHITECTURE.md. Just create directory, add README, run stow.
scalability_considerations.cross_platform_support: Good - installer detects OS and adjusts. Some packages may have platform-specific configs (e.g., wezterm macOS-only mentioned).
scalability_considerations.team_collaboration: Excellent - clear contribution path, automated checks, non-destructive Stow installation allows safe testing.
scalability_considerations.version_management: Needs improvement - no CHANGELOG or semantic versioning yet. Only git commit history.
scalability_considerations.performance: Excellent - lazy loading in Neovim, minimal startup overhead. CI/CD runs efficiently (<5 min estimated).

security_assessment.secrets_management: Excellent - .gitignore blocks credentials, keys, tokens. Security scanning in CI (TruffleHog).
security_assessment.script_safety: Good - install.sh uses 'set -e' for error handling. Dry-run available. Backup creation before modifications.
security_assessment.dependency_pinning: Partial - submodules pinned to commits. Neovim plugins not pinned (lazy.nvim auto-updates).
security_assessment.access_control: N/A - personal dotfiles repo. If team-shared, consider branch protection rules.

maintainability_score.notes: High-quality project with professional tooling. Minor documentation inconsistencies are only significant issues. Automation could be enhanced with integration testing.
